context: I got 2 working arms and legs. I am so thankful for that.
speaker_utterance: I got 2 working arms and legs. I am so thankful for that.
original_listener_response: That is good to hear. Disabilities are never easy for people.
Test2.1_response: I'm glad to hear that you are feeling grateful for your health and mobility. It's definitely something to be thankful for.
Test2.2_response: That's great to hear! Having the ability to use all your limbs is definitely something to be grateful for.

context: This week is a big week for me at my job. I should find out if I get a bonus or not.
speaker_utterance: This week is a big week for me at my job.
original_listener_response: Do you think it will be good news or bad news?
Test2.1_response: I can imagine how you must be feeling with the anticipation of finding out if you'll get a bonus or not. It's natural to feel a mix of excitement and nerves in situations like this. I'll keep my fingers crossed for you!
Test2.2_response: That's exciting to hear! What's happening at your job this week?

context: I forgot my words when giving a speech.
speaker_utterance: I forgot my words when giving a speech. I completely messed up!
original_listener_response: Oh no. Was it a important speech?
Test2.1_response: Don't worry, it happens to everyone at some point. It's completely normal to feel embarrassed, but remember that mistakes are a part of the learning process. I'm sure the audience understands and appreciates your effort. Just take a deep breath and keep going, you got this!
Test2.2_response: It's okay, everyone makes mistakes from time to time. The important thing is that you tried your best. Maybe you could practice more or try some relaxation techniques to help with nerves next time. Keep at it, you'll get better with practice!

context: I am about to embark on a three month trip. I am having second thoughts about it.
speaker_utterance: I am having second thoughts about my three month long trip.
original_listener_response: That's a long time to be away. Are you going by yourself?
Test2.1_response: It's completely normal to feel anxious or have second thoughts before embarking on a long trip. Is there anything specific that's making you unsure about going? Remember, it's okay to have these feelings, and it's important to take the time to address them before making a decision.
Test2.2_response: It's completely normal to have doubts and second thoughts before embarking on a big trip like that. What's been on your mind?

context: When I worked at a bank, a man came in to rob us.  He had on a mask and had a gun.  We thankfully had a security guard in the back who detained him
speaker_utterance: When I worked at a bank, a man came in with a gun to rob us
original_listener_response: That is so scary! Did they catch him?
Test2.1_response: Oh, that sounds terrifying. I'm relieved to hear that you had a security guard who was able to detain him. It must have been a really scary experience for you.
Test2.2_response: That must have been a terrifying experience. I'm glad to see that you are safe.

context: I saw myself doing jumping jacks in the mirror with my shirt off, ugh.
speaker_utterance: I saw myself doing jumping jacks in the mirror with my shirt off, ugh.
original_listener_response: If you keep doing them you'll look better!
Test2.1_response: I can imagine that must have been a bit jarring to see. It's totally natural to feel a bit disgusted by unexpected reflections of ourselves. Just remember, we all have moments like that!
Test2.2_response: It's totally normal to feel self-conscious about seeing yourself in that way. Remember, everyone has insecurities about their body, but it's important to focus on being healthy and strong rather than just appearance. Keep up the good work with your exercise routine!

context: I called my new boss about when I need to come in to work for the first time, and they said they'd call me back. I keep waiting for the phone to ring, and it's getting late, but they're not calling me.
speaker_utterance: I'm transferring to a new job and it's just beena  headache getting the paperwork done. I called my new boss to ask when I come into work, and they said they'd call me back. It's getting pretty late and I've been guarding my phone, but they still haven't called me back.
original_listener_response: that's annoying. maybe you should try giving them a call again?
Test2.1_response: I can imagine how frustrating and nerve-wracking it must be to keep waiting for that call. It sounds like you're really eager to start your new job. Hang in there, hopefully, they'll get back to you soon.
Test2.2_response: I can imagine how frustrating that must be for you. It's tough waiting for important information, especially when it involves starting a new job. Hopefully, your new boss will get back to you soon with all the details you need. Just try to hang in there a little longer.

context: I went to set at dinner with a girl who I thought was my girlfriend. My girlfriend saw the whole thing.
speaker_utterance: I went to set at dinner with a girl who I thought was my girlfriend. My girlfriend saw the whole thing.
Test2.1_response: I can only imagine how embarrassed you must feel. That sounds like a very awkward situation. Have you had a chance to talk to your girlfriend and explain the misunderstanding?
Test2.2_response: Oh no, that must have been a really awkward situation. How did you handle it?

context: I hate olives and the other day I was eating a salad and there was one in there :(
speaker_utterance: I absolutely hate olives. The other day I was eating a salad I got from Whole Foods and somehow a stray black olive was in there. >:(
original_listener_response: Eww! I really hate olives also. What things do you like in your salad?
Test2.1_response: Oh no, that sounds terrible! I can imagine how disgusted you must have felt when you found that olive in your salad. It's always frustrating when something you dislike sneaks into your food like that. I hope the rest of the salad was enjoyable at least!
Test2.2_response: Oh no, that must have been so disappointing for you! It can be frustrating when a food you dislike sneaks its way into your meal. Hopefully, your next salad will be olive-free!
